snippet: Visa troubles for the reporter and for the new Beijing bureau chief of The Times come amid government pressure on the foreign media over investigations into the finances of senior Chinese leaders.
abstract: Chinese government declines to issue 2013 visa for Beijing-based New York Times correspondent, forcing him to leave mainland, and continues to delay processing for  newspaper's new Beijing bureau chief; visa troubles come amid government pressure on foreign news media over investigations into finances of senior Chinese officials.
lead_paragraph: Visa troubles for the reporter and for the new Beijing bureau chief of The Times come amid government pressure on the foreign media over investigations into the finances of senior Chinese leaders.

headline.seo: Times Reporter in China Is Forced to Leave Over Visa Issue
headline.main: Visa Issue in China Forces Out Times Reporter
headline.print_headline: Visa Issue In China Forces Out Reporter
